name: Simpsons of Potts Point Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Simpsons for 3 nights at the beginning of our Honeymoon to Australia, and again for 1 night before returning home. We were warmly welcomed by Keith when we arrived early at 6:30 am and were able to get into our fantastic room (Cloud Suite) to freshen up. Keith gave us some great information and maps to help us around on our first day in Sydney - a fantastic host with lots of local knowledge. All of the Simpsons team were friendly and welcoming.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, rooms and hosts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location of Simpsons is fantastic. Walk to the end of the road and you have a great view of the Sydney skyline, Opera House and Bridge which really took our breath away. There is a small, public gardens at the end of Challis Avenue where you can relax with the views and locals walking their dogs just 2 minutes from the Hotel. Central Sydney is a wonderful walk away (30 minutes or so) through Woolloomooloo, past the Finger Wharf and Royal Botanic Gardens to get to Circular Quays where you can reach anything with public transport links.
reviews.title: Lovely boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and very comfortable, breakfast is delicious - particularly the Rhubarb Compote and the Muffins are great too. For a splash of luxury in Sydney, Simpsons offers reasonable value in a fantastic location as an alternative to a lot of chain / boutique hotels.
reviews.title: elegant country house in the heart of the city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Potts Point itself is a great area with many cafés and restaurants right on the doorstep. A particular favourite for us was Dolcetta (walk down from Simpsons, turn left into Victoria Street and it's on the right after about 8 minutes walk). This is a wonderful streetside providore serving excellent food (BYO wine) and fantastic coffee with flawless service. We really felt like we were experiencing a local treat here.
reviews.title: Perfection; Deserves a 4th Star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For another amazing Sydney experience, we ate at Ripples Café by the Olympic Pool beside the Harbour Bridge on our last night. Another BYO, I cannot recommend this restaurant enough for food, service and location. Fantastic.
reviews.title: A home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a really charming hotel and very much like living in a large Edwardian house with all the trimmings. Lovely stained glass windows, large bedrooms with tea and coffee, ironing board, TV, air con, clean and comfortable. Large and cozy living room, with sherry at the ready after a busy day. Free access to the Internet is a great touch. Not a large hotel, so quite personal.
reviews.title: Everything you could want
Great location, very personal service
reviews.text: No pool or gardens, but who has time for this as there is so much to do in Sydney and the Botanical Gardens are practically on your door step?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was excellent, not in the thick of it, but an easy walk to the centre of town (20 mins max) or a fairly cheap taxi ride. It's also close to Kings Cross, the red light district - but this isnt a particular draw back, far from it. It means that restaurants and bars are open a little later close to the hotel. The hotel itself is in a quiet street off the main drag so there's no disturbance.
reviews.title: Delightful, offering superb value for $

likes.liked: — Vibrant neighbourhood, room amenities, complimentary use of computer, complimentary sherry, proximity to good restaurants, bus stops, shops, sites
likes.disliked: — If I have to pick SOMETHING - double beds pushed together for a

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was fine - coffee, tea, juices and toast with jams or soft cheese. Just enough to start you off for the day. Good size breakfast room with daily papers and tourist info, maps etc.
reviews.title: Perfect location, hosts, stay

likes.liked: — The most comfortable bed. Location is central, but not noisy!
likes.disliked: — Need new wardrobes - or even antique ones. More room to hang clothes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not particularly cheap, but comparable to other hotels of a similar class. Very nice place to stay and thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: Could not have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Keith and Marie make you so welcome, perfect location to walk through Botanic Gardens to bridge and harbour area. Hotel relaxed and comfortable, perfect alternative to the big chains but with all possible amenities including a shower and bathroom to use before or after checking in / out., with a left luggage facility so we could spend the day in town for an late afternoon flight also free internet. A wonderful haven to find in a big city, wouldn't stay anywhere else in Sydney
reviews.title: what a welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here several nights in January before embarking on a cruise. We chose this hotel because we did not want to stay with the masses of tourists staying around the ship quays--we would be seeing them on the ships. We wanted to get a more local feel of the area.
reviews.title: Wonderful Intro to Australia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: This was a wonderful place to stay!! We were able to check in early after our long flight. Keith then helped us "fine tune" our research. The hotel location is within easy walking distance of the things we wanted to do within Sydney proper. The maps of Sydney make it look huge--but it is very walkable--distances are not that great. A few times we walked to Circular Quay and caught the local ferries to places like Manly Beach and Watson Bay. I was very impressed with the local transportation--and the prices were great!!
reviews.title: I wish all hotels were like this......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Vanessa was a great help, too! Her restaurant suggestions were right on! We walked only 1-3 minutes to the restaurants for dinner. Definitely local vibes--how cool! Some of the restaurants let you bring your own wine and the corkage fee is low. There is shopping around the corner from the hotel--everything you need. Also, there is a Chinese laundry across the street that turned our clothes around in four hours for an extremely reasonable price.
reviews.title: The only place to stay in Sydney
Simpsons- Superb
reviews.text: Simpson's was charming. We were very pleased with our experience. They even had free wireless. Wish we could have stayed longer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I needed accommodation close to the City, which provided support for my business requirements, but also had a personal touch. I found Keith, Marie and Vanessa incredibly helpful and informative. This is a very special boutique hotel in a great location, run by outstanding people. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Peaceful Retreat in the Heart of Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I understand why Simpsons is the #1 Trip Advisor hotel in Sydney. We stayed there on our first night in Australia, and it was perfect! The restored 1920's house is warm and welcoming, as are Keith and Vanessa, the hosts whom we met. The room was comfortable and inviting, breakfast was delicious, and Vanessa gave us a map with a detailed itinerary for our first day that provided us with a great experience of the city and kept us awake and moving through jet lag after a 22 hr. trip. We look forward to returning.
reviews.title: The epitomy of warm hospitality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Simpsons Hotel is a home from home!
reviews.title: A home from home!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a 2 night stay at Simpsons Hotel after reading about it here on Trip Advisor. No wonder it is voted best place to stay in Sydney! It is a gorgeous little boutique hotel. It really feels like you are staying with a rich friend!
reviews.title: A peaceful haven in a wonderfully lively city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a dormer room which was very spacious and beautifully decorated. The bed was extremely comfortable and there were all the amenities you would need including an iron & ironing board!
reviews.title: Like Staying With Family

likes.disliked: — The shower door allows minor flooding in bathroom!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can only endorse what others have included in their reviews. This small hotel is a real haven after a busy sightseeing day. The staff were so helpful, particularly with suggestions of where to go and what to see in the limited time we had. The many restaurants within 50 metres were superb, especially The Sardine Room. The walk into the centre through the Botanic Gardens was lovely though there were many steps to negotiate on the way. This was fine going into the city but coming back (rather tired) we found it easier to take a 311 bus from Circular Quay! The many and efficient ferries running from the Quay offer a wealth of places to see and I would recommend Watson's Bay and South head, a bus to Bondi and a walk to Bronte or Coogee but Keith in the hotel will be happy to tell you all about where to go. A trip to the Blue Mountains is a must, but only if the weather is good. We took a guided tour which collected us from the hotel and ended with a ferry from the Olympic Park back into the city and we felt it was excellent value for money but it is possible to do it on the train. All in all we had six fantastic days and should we go back to Sydney (there are so many other places we want to see!) we would certainly stay at Simpsons.
reviews.title: a real oasis

likes.disliked: — View from room to adjoining property but it wasn't a problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had the pleasure of spending 8 nights at the Simpsons Hotel. I was warmly welcomed to this 12 room boutique hotel (B&B) by Vanessa who provided me with directions for a day of sight seeing. It is an easy walk to the Opera House, Botanic Gardens and the Shopping areas. The bus routes are very convenient if you are not a walker. The hotel is a hertiage building which has lovely antique furniture, fireplace and free internet service. Breakfast is served in the sunny solarium where you have the opportunity to meet other travellers. This is a gem of a hotel for those who prefer a cosy and warm atmosphere with personalized attention. I will be returning in 2009!
reviews.title: Warm atmosphere and attentive service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent six wonderfull nights at Simpsons, a nice boutique hotel close to the city centre, the botanical gardens and numerous good restuarants. We had a ground floor room which was very comfortable and quiet.
reviews.title: Six wonderfull nights.

likes.disliked: — No views (but then they were all around the corner)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The friendly helpfull service from Keith, Vanessa and the other staff, was exactly as earlier postings had inferred. Nothing seemed to be too much trouble and Keith's knowledge of the city and its attractions was fantastic. The little extra tips on where to go, what to see etc. was most usefull.
reviews.title: Simpsons, a real gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Return to Sydney? Yes, if only to stay at the Simpsons.
reviews.title: Simply the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I've chosen this lovely hotel based on what I've read in trip advisor before. Once there, I was delighted to the utmost!.
reviews.title: What else to say?

likes.liked: — The room quality, the quality of the service, and the host, the location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I arrived early morning and Keith welcomed me warmly and he instantly provided all important information what to do that early morning until my room was available around lunch time. So even before I could enter my room, I had a great walk along the harbour and in the parks, thanks to Keith. And thanks to Keith's precise inputs which were supported by some sketches I did not miss any spot that morning.
reviews.title: Fantastic location with warm friendly owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Once back, Vanessa made me familiar with my room and I instantly felt home at this lovely place. Since this was my first trip to Australia, I only can say that there is no better "Australian-Opening-Label" than this lovely place with its warm-hearted and caring hosts. I seldom felt myself such comfortable and home after such a short time. Thank you all, Keith, Marie and Vanessa and your staff.
reviews.title: No wonder they are #1 - they earn it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Finally I staid at Simpsons a full week and took again some nights on my way back from Melbourne to my home country.
reviews.title: Spoiled for the rest of our trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I fully agree with all previous reviews and actually nothing can be mentioned anymore. All has been said and I just could express my great and positive impression as well. It's a great place to stay at a perfect location in walking distance to almost all attractions in Sydney.
reviews.title: Simpsons is fabulous

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008
reviews.text: I am impressed. This was my first experience in boutique hotel, and I think this a great one to be used as reference for all others!
reviews.title: Perfect place in Sydney

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed there for 6 nights (myself, my wife and my sister), where we booked two rooms. We got a large room (Challis Room) downstairs next to the breakfast area, and my sister got a smaller room in the last floor.
reviews.title: Fantastic.....

likes.liked: — Decor in keeping with the house and very clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Service: Great personalized service! Vanessa, our host for most of the days, was great at welcoming us into the establishment as soon as we arrived, and catered to our requests whenever had one, including heaps of useful info about what to do and where to go in Sydney. We arrived very early from Dubai, and Vanessa was able to get us our rooms early so we can sleep off the 14 hours of flight we got into! I thought that was great!
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Great spacious rooms with comfy beds. They had everything you needed for your stay tucked away in the closet (iron, ironing board etc etc). The bathroom is good - not extremely spacious, but still nice. My concern there is that when you flush the toilet, it takes a really long time to "reload", and with it comes the sound, which could be slightly annoying at night. I found that in both my room and my sister's room so I assume it is across. Nothing major, but a small concern. My only advice, regarding our room location, if you are someone who is a light sleeper, and would like to sleep through the morning hours, is to book a room "away" from the breakfast area. Our room was right next to it, so we heard early breakfast go-ers sometimes.
reviews.title: Deservedly number one!

likes.disliked: — View from our room not good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: Fabulous! A 10 minutes walk from the KingsCross metro station, a 20 minutes walk to Circular Quay ... makes this place superb! Botanical gardens are on the way to Circular Quay and the Opera, so you even opt for longer scenic walks if you want to! Many grocery stores are close by, laundry is also close by as well as some restaurants, all found on your way to the KingsCross metro station. Our only initial concern was the proximity of KingsCross road - but everyone told us that is safe to walk through if needed.
reviews.title: If I ran a B+B, I'd want it to be like this one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here in the Cloud suite for 5 nights with my fiancee in Jan 07 after spending the previous 14 nights in serviced apartments in Melbourne and Sydney. The change was certainly welcome - Room was very impressive with a large bed, fantastic decor and large jacussi spa in the bathroom. When the jacussi was on it sounded like the bath was going to take off but that all added to the experience.
reviews.title: As good as all the reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: One of the best aspects of the hotel in the communal areas including a big living room with board games, books and free broadband internet access. This room also has a bathroom with shower which makes it ideal if you have a late flight out like we did.
reviews.title: Lovely Experience!

likes.liked: — Size of room, decor, cleanliness and comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: To all the readers, if you are choosing this hotel know that you are booking a boutique style hotel that is smaller and doesn't necessarily have what a 5 star luxury hotel would have. What you are paying for at this hotel is the impeccable service; any request within reason is met with extreme promptness. I stayed in two different rooms during my 7+1 day stay here in Sydney with the biggest difference being the flat screen TV in one room and a 13" CRT in the other. Apparently 10 out of the 12 rooms do have flat screens so if you're looking for a better TV in your room, request one that does. I would have liked some premium movie channels with my room but I was out and about for most of the time so this was not that big of a deal. The internet was spotty on my first day of arrival, but that got quickly fixed and it was reliable during the rest of the stay. The continental breakfast is sufficient but those that want a hot eggs & bacon style breakfast will be disappointed. The decor is charming for the most part, though for the fastidious there are some areas that need a little sanding/repainting. Potts Point is definitely a trendy, charming area to stay and the walk through the Royal Botannical Gardens to the Opera House and then the Circular Quay is a nice 20-30 minute stroll. I do wish the price were a little lower as this was the most expensive place for my trip but I stayed during the extremely busy time of Mardis Gras so the prices were reasonable due to the demand and due to the fact that Sydney is a relatively expensive city. All in all I enjoyed my stay and would gladly return the next time I'm in Sydney.
reviews.title: Good Boutique Hotel with Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travelled in Australia for a month. On our last day, we stayed at Simpsons of Potts.
reviews.title: Absolutely charming Bed & Breakfast

The B & B is absolutely charrming.. what a gem in a perfect location.. within walking distance to some great restaurants, shopping and to the Opera House.
reviews.title: Really excellent service but slightly tatty place
No way should this be the number 1 hotel in Sydney!

reviews.text: Brian & Veronica, Toronto, Canada
reviews.title: Simply Fantastic & Friendly

description: "Simpsons" is an intimate 12 - room B&B boutique hotel, situated within a restored 1892 Victorian mansion, and is very centrally located in leafy tree-lined Potts Point, a vibrant and cosmopolitan area, being the closest suburb east of the City, with many interesting restaurants, bars, galleries and cafes nearby, yet only a 20 minute walk to the beauty of Sydney Harbour and Opera House.
